channel.title: Forum Rules
channel.description:
Rule 7: A moderators decision is final, if you have a problem with it, pm an administrator. Trying to resolve it through a thread will result in a heavier punishment.
Shouldn't it be:
A moderator[b]'[/b]s decision is final, if you have a problem with it, pm an administrator. Trying to resolve it through a thread will result in a heavier punishment.
I'm not sure if this was overlooked or not...

item.title: Forum Rules
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

I heard mopar always has lots of time on his hands… if he’s not inebriated.

Read full topic

item.title: Forum Rules
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

the wanderer:

Since the rules are such widely read

hahahaha

hahahahahahaha

they really aren’t

ps an admin wouldn’t mind capitalizing your name if you pm them. I suggest mopman, he’s a nice chap

Read full topic

item.title: Forum Rules
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Please don’t fix it.

Please.

Read full topic

item.title: Forum Rules
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

Greeny:

Although I feel inclined to point out you probably should have capitalised your forum name on registration. Basic grammar!

Do not remind me… I cringe every moment I look at my name and wonder what I was thinking that day I registered. It annoys me so bad…

Greeny:

I wouldn’t recommend going round like a grammar Nazi though, since many of our users are from all over the world, and expectedly multilingual. Many speak English as their second language, and it would be unfair to judge them on written text when you probably (and I am assuming) can’t speak their language at all.

That is a very valid point right there. I actually thank you for pointing that out, as now that I look back I have been judgmental on other users because of their grammar, and it turned out they spoke fluent French or German. Again I thank you for that.

[quote=“Bebe, post:7, topic:389355”][quote author=the wanderer link=topic=485273.msg3555542#msg3555542 date=1301857867]
Since the rules are such widely read,
[/quote]
Lol.[/quote]
:’) Thanks for fixing it also.

Read full topic

item.title: Forum Rules
item.dc:creator: @Bebemycat2 Bebe
item.description:
@Bebemycat2 wrote:

[quote=“the wanderer, post:5, topic:389355”]You don’t judge a book by its cover.

Nobody is perfect. I actually considered sending a PM, but I was unsure. I figured the worst thing that could happen was that my thread would get locked and in the end a Administrator/Moderator would read the topic and fix the grammatical error. Since the rules are such widely read, I personally would like them to be grammatically correct. Obviously it isn’t up to me, but as I stated above it is a personal peeve of mine.[/quote]
Lol.

I fixed it btw.

Read full topic

item.title: Forum Rules
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

Haha, who doesn’t like good grammar?.. other than those whom are inept at it. Although I feel inclined to point out you probably should have capitalised your forum name on registration. Basic grammar!

I wouldn’t recommend going round like a grammar Nazi though, since many of our users are from all over the world, and expectedly multilingual. Many speak English as their second language, and it would be unfair to judge them on written text when you probably (and I am assuming) can’t speak their language at all.

Nevertheless, I wasn’t annoyed and I’m sure it’ll be fixed accordingly.

Read full topic

item.title: Forum Rules
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

You don’t judge a book by its cover.

Nobody is perfect. I actually considered sending a PM, but I was unsure. I figured the worst thing that could happen was that my thread would get locked and in the end a Administrator/Moderator would read the topic and fix the grammatical error. Since the rules are such widely read, I personally would like them to be grammatically correct. Obviously it isn’t up to me, but as I stated above it is a personal peeve of mine.

Read full topic

item.title: Forum Rules
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

What Greeny meant was that the rule suggest contacting an administrator in those cases, and perhaps you should have done the same in this case.

You don’t judge a book by it’s cover.

Read full topic

item.title: Forum Rules
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

Just a pet peeve of mine. I understand if you don’t think it was necessary, and I wouldn’t object to you either. I always thought grammar and vocabulary shows who a person is, and in this sense the community. I know you aren’t supposed to “judge the book by its cover”, but it does show a lot about who a person is. I know this community is, for the most part, intelligent. Sorry if I annoyed you in any way.

Read full topic

item.title: Forum Rules
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

After reading that particular rule, did you really think it necessary to make a thread for suggesting a slight punctuation change.

Read full topic

item.title: Forum Rules
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

Rule 7: A moderators decision is final, if you have a problem with it, pm an administrator. Trying to resolve it through a thread will result in a heavier punishment.

Shouldn’t it be:

A moderator[b]'[/b]s decision is final, if you have a problem with it, pm an administrator. Trying to resolve it through a thread will result in a heavier punishment.
I'm not sure if this was overlooked or not...

Read full topic
